values:
Well, not really. More...Catch - up.

Tonight. Angiogram. Head. Neck. done and done. Lord willing it will show something. ANYTHING!! I'll take anything. Lots of prayer is being prayed. I know. Thank you.

Cats, check. Good. We're good. Lots of headaches, check. Good. School starting up? Check. Yup. Teacher's orders? Check! Christmas in the office, says I! 

New tattoo - check! I love it. Ask me about it some time. 

Peace friends
I just thought you should know that not only is my upper lip totally numb and tingly,and has been for about an hour, the bridge of my nose just joined the party! ACK!
This is what my desk looks like. >>UGH<<

It's been an interesting few weeks... School is seriously ramping up, the headache of doom was there for a while too. It's not even august and i really feel like the summer is almost over! i have a ton to do at work, and really need to settle into a routine for life. Here's what I've got so far, tell me what you think: (i mean that)
wake up: 6:25
read/journal/meditate: 6:30-7:15
get ready for day and leave by work at 7:45
work 8:00-4:00 (for fall)
go "out" one evening per week (probably bible study)
dinner at 6:00
wind down around 9:00 (this includes make lunch for next day!)
bed at 10:00

fun, huh? I feel like I'm either 9 or 90, I can't tell. I kinda like it, but it feels a little restricting. No more caffiene for me these days too, which makes 10 feel pretty good for bed :)

Renee came back into town breifly last night (and for today) and while listening to some of her stories last night I realized that what I really want out of life is to ENJOY and be content with less and less. To live much more simply with my time, my space, my money, my thoughts. All of that. Yoga, meditation, twelve steps, I think they all get us to the same place - serenity, and I think serenity is necessarily simpler. right? O_O
I found the interview this morning, on Youtube of course, and thought I would put the link up. I may poke around for more interviews with them!

I just watched Pan's Labyrinth and it was really good! Not scary at all! Definitely hard to watch-but good. I'm now watching a Charlie Rose interview of del toro, cuaron, and another guy whose name I can't remember. I would love to sit down with Cuaron and del toro! They are such amazing and creative men. The other man is to but I can't remember his name!

Trying to buy coffee, when you haven't had any coffee, can be a grueling and emberassing experience. I had no cream (cookies for my cream? anyone?) and thus could not drink my coffee. I know, I know, I should bite the bullet, be cool like everyone else and drink black coffee. I rebel against the system!! Ha ha! Anyway. Of course I know where every coffee shop is within a 2 mile radius, but their store hours? TOTALLY different story. Plus I kinda wanna support(a) the small ones (eek to the starbucks and seattle's best - plus, if I went to seattle's best, I would buy books...) This was also about 7:15 in the morning. I should have gone to Taza D'Oro, but alas, I wanted to actually head in the direction of work. Not away. Even a half mile, that's too much to ask pre-coffee. (I love that I can't think rationally without coffee so therefore went about as far away as I could out of my way, when really I should have just gone to Taza) (I have now had my coffee and can think logically)

Right. Sooo... (Really, If you've read this far, I'm impressed) I tried Oh, Yeah. I really wanted to buy yummy organic, fair trade, cute guy serving me, coffee from them, but nooooo. Not open til 8! I need coffee before 8! !!!  !!!

So then, I've already set out on the coffee mission, with no coffee, so I can't give up now. So Walnut St. Jitters? NO. Creepy, creepy guy reading newspaper in front, must walk around, don't make eye contact. ew! don't look at my legs! yuck! Sorry. Okay. Coffee Tree Roasters? YES! Garage door of ventilation OPEN! Coffee! $1.50 later I have what I need, go back past creepy newspaper guy, and sip my coffee. all is right with the world, and I am not even late to work, even though I went about 1.5 miles out of my way. Oops. I'll know better next time. 

Watch for more, I'm onna roll.

So...no real diagnosis, which is ok. The plan is physical therapy, drugs, and another MRI. This time it will be an open one. And as my mom noted at least the drugs will make me really relaxed! Back to see the neurologist in six weeks.

I'm off to see Dr. Smolar today. Molly is coming with, due to a good idea of Amber's...Two set of ears are much better than one. I just hope he has insight into what's going on. I've written up everything I can think of (i have no idea what he'll want to know)...and I'm not excited about how much pain i'm going to be in tomorrow, but alas it must be so. I pray for peace, and a good attitude.

This isn't entirely true... But I pretty much sat around feeling pity for my sinuses. I read up on composting and watched all of the Harry potter movies. Now I'm reading about Guatemala and listening to kids set off fireworks. It's a day late guys. Hush.

Wow. I have discovered a few dangerous things on the internet....

www.hulu.com
www.ummyeah.com
www.phonezoo.com


it's like playing with fire...july will not be a productive month..

Oops.

quickie update.

MRI tomorrow, with IV contrast. yuck. ew. and not looking forward to it.

moving friday! looking forward to that.  i should be sleeping there totally and for sure (with cats) by sunday! yay!

It's been quite a ride over the past few weeks. I've been learning the ropes at PUCS, packing to move soon, hanging out more and more, and house-sitting. I feel really content right now, and have a pretty serious assuredness that I am in the right place right now. Lots of things on my mind, of course, but God is so good, and taking good care of me. I look forward to another week of work, trying to figure more out, and more summer hanging out. Peace!

It was a grand day in the city. It was purposeful, yet slow enough to enjoy everything. Even the humidity and heat. I got lots of moments to pause and think, and lots of movement, which is good too. I learned how to tune up a bike! yay! (thanks quinn!!) and I walked in the woods for a while, and drank red bean tea. it was pretty glorious.

Last night was the Over the Rhine show, which was amazing. Karin's voice just makes me melt. and want to dance. and make out with poeple. oh wait, what?? right.

We went to Fat Heads afterward, which was actually really chill and fun. I ran into some Hot Metal people, and it was just so great, to be in the city - running into people and being out in the city at night. it was good. 

Hopefully tomorrow I will get to ride my bike (i'm shooting for 9:30am) before it gets too hot...then some writing, and MASSAGE! yay! the day has come.

please excuse the excessive amounts of punctuation in this post. :)

The kids are gone, the music is playing, the coffee is being drunk...ahhhh...summer is here.

First day on the job alone...went well. It was SO quiet, but good to feel comfortable, no fear of puking children running into the office. It was good. I'm still feeling a little heartbroken about the penguins, but I'm sure I'll get over it. I was thinking today about the irony of the hockey season just being over, and how RIDICULOUSLY hot and humid it was today. Don't get me wrong, I'm glad it's warm, but geez...the office? A SWEAT BOX!!! I have to try and look cute, and have breathable, comfortable clothes on? shoot. 

the pool ministry will begin for me on monday...

oh. and PACKING. i hate it.

more fragments! maybe a bike on sat??
There is so much in my head right now. Hopefully I will sleep. We'll see. Tomorrow is tomorrow, and sleep is now.

Can I just tell you how happy this makes me???

I would pounce on people, from high up in the trees.... then run away laughing

A few interesting things. 

It is june 1st. Officially I have health care! Hooray!

Islands with dinosaurs = falling in love

i have lost hope for the penguins.


OH! And i have an apartment for july 1. Yesssss.... Yard sale, here i come. Watch out!!

I've been at an amazing conference this week. I'm glad to be home, i met some amazing people, and have some great insight into my life in the future. I lost a good friend while I was there, and I'm definitely grieving. I'm excited to be back and able to process everything.

I'm envoking a little Tony the Tiger there....

But really, today was great. I had enough brain left to have coffee with sarah, and post! yay! and i'll be able to read coherently tonight! yeah! I'm just so excited that my brain is functioning so well. It is getting better, like everyone said.

Well, I finished Book One of the Edge Chronicles, and I'm gonna start on book two in a minute. must eat dinner first. but i'm excited!!! Sarah recommended a couple books to me, one by Carol Sheilds, and Kafka on the shore, by somebody. I'm going to try and find them soon.

Indiana Jones!! I'm so excited. OH! and i watched A Good Woman last night, which was really good.

I now officially have 1-7 of the Edge Chronicles. I am in love with the entire cast of The Chronicles of Narnia: Prince Caspian. I sold the last of my college textbooks. Am I regressing?? 

Just Kidding.

I have a "real" job now. I look forward to watching shows where divas and melodramatic straight men make clothes on ridiculous time lines. My bed time is around 9:30. I think leggings are stupid. I do laundry on the weekends. I wake up on my own at 7am. Clearly I am moving forward :)
So many attractive people. RUINED (well not quite, but almost) by Regina. I realize it's not her fault. I need a cheesy sword picture.

My brain power at this point is about zero. 
The new job: a good fit, not horrible, mostly overwhelming, lots of encouragement.

more later. can't think now.

I sit here, watching the end of Guys and Dolls, typing on my computer (of which i think i need to upgrade), and i look at my pretty new handbag, and guess what? I feel sick. I feel absolutely sick at the affluence I think i should be afforded. The lifestyle I think I deserve. Where in the HELL did this idea come from? Credit? Living above my means? Being owed "new things", shiny things, an upgrade?? What??? I have enough. I have more than enough. I don't know how to take the first step towards truly being empty of this world and it's ambitions. I know the way, I know who to follow, and yet I can't. All the broken things in me step in and say "no", at one time, collectively - and the conviction doesn't last.
Oh man. I'm a little in love with this guy.

Reading the news this morning was a bad idea. Note for future reference: Monday am + Pre-Coffee stupor + News = Feeling a lot like Chicken Little (or chicken licken - however you like it). Earthquakes in China, Myanmar, tornados in the southern USA, the world "recession", gas prices, food prices....YIKES

Ok. I admit it freely, I was really excited about this book. But as i finished it last night, I was a little disappointed. DWJ is AWESOME! and I absolutely love her writing, but well, it was the last in this series, and I have to say, I liked the first two the best. Maybe that's not a problem, but there was so much hype for me about this book, that I guess I had high expectations...

On another note, I'm really interested in reading some female theologians next... Got anything good?

I have been very aware today that I am being taken care of. I see how not getting into grad school was a part of the path I am on, a part of the puzzle of my life, so to speak. I am aware that this job I've taken is going to be very hard. Next year will be trial by fire, but God is with me...and God is faithful. I was just talking to a friend tonight that made me even more thoughtful about where I am now, and that I am moving forward and this is good. 

I just feel so thankful.

*dances around*

I got the job! I got the job! I got the job! 


Hooray!

How attractive are these men?



After thinking about my uncomfortable-ness over the whole bad guy thing (Timothy was right, it wasn't out of the blue, clearly set within a context) I've decided I officially REALLY like this movie.

1 Who are your favorite Five Authors?
    1. Ann Lamott
    2. Lewis Caroll
    3. Christopher Moor
    4. Alan Lightman
    5. Lillian Jackson Braun

2 What are your favorite works by them?
    1. Rosie
    2. Through the Looking Glass
    3. Island of the Sequined Love Nun
    4. Einstein's Dreams
    5. That's hard...Probably the Cat Who Turned On and Off


3 What book(s) do you NOT own that you wish you did?
    I wish that I owned the Great Books series

4 Do you enjoy read-alongs and sharing with friends?
    Yes.

5 How much do you read? (no shame, be truthful)
    Very Quickly (finishing 1-2 books a week)

6 What do you eat or drink while you read?
    Coffee

7 Where do you read? (bathroom included, don't lie)
    Anywhere and everywhere. Mostly in coffee shops or in my recliner

8 What do you use as a bookmark?
    I don't use them

9 Do you read more than one book at a time? How many?
    Absolutely. I'm currently reading 4 right now.


10 List your favorite genres, from most liked to least liked.
    Fantasy
    Biography
    Memior
    Mystery (*fluff* only)
    History
    Classic "Sci-Fi"
    I detest horror

11 What is the longest story you have read? (Multiple volumes included)
    I think Harry Potter...although they are single stories I'd put Babysitters Club (in elementary school) and Nancy Drew (also elem.         school)

12 Deserted Island; Choose!
    Fiction Or Non-Fiction -- fiction
    Fantasy Or Sci-Fi -- fantasy
    Western Or Romance -- western
    History Or Biography -- biography
    Other (explain) -- CHILDREN'S!

13 Book character that most resembles your inner self.
    When I read Rosie I think I was like Rae...but I've changed...I'd like to say I'm like someone from a Bronte novel... :)

14 A book you would suggest as a "must read" to any friend.
    The bible! (good answer...pats self on back)
    OR
    Madeline L'Engle's series

15 Have you ever tried to write a book? Would you like to?
    No. Maybe.

16 Are you published?
    Actually, yes. I had a poem published in an anthology in 3rd grade *smile*

I really like

Finally Lyrics
 this song


and I really like this band
Uh, I do not ship H/H...but I hadn't seen this and - thank you Renee - it's pretty great.

I hate waiting. What is that phrase? "Good things come to those who wait" (*laughs* i just looked that phrase up, and found this on wikipediaL the phrase "is an advertising slogan used by Diageo in television, cinema, and print advertising campaigns promoting Guinness-brand draught stout in the United Kingdom. The slogan formed the cornerstone of advertising agency Abbott Mead Vickers BBDO's successful pitch to secure the Guinness account in 1996")

But anyway. I don't like anticipation. I hate the process of trying to let go of anxiety, or rather, acknowledging that i feel anxious about something, and just living with it. YUCK. I just want to know what's going on... although, I don't know that I will ever really know that.

We talked a little at midrash about being community... and one of my thoughts on that is that I want to be a person who is lead through life, by the holy spirit, allowing myself to be transformed, to love others, and to give glory to God... but EVERYTHING in me wants to be in control, wants to know the formula, the "right path" etc... oy. how to live with tension. I'm learning...

(PS this has nothing to do with this post, but here is something I've been enjoying looking at: Zen Habits)

I thought to myself before the race... there is going to be a terrible accident.

This was weird because usually I feel no impending doom upon the start of the race.

But good gravy, was there ever a bad accident. I'm not sure on what lap, but my adorable Heikki crashed into the tire wall, producing what someone said may have been a 26g force - wedging the car into the tire wall. YIKES.



The absolutely amazing thing is he has not one broken bone. Not one.

In other excitement - next race (Turkey) should be Barrichello's 257 race, and hopefully he and his team will be celebrating the "most experienced F1 driver" that weekend!

Last night was really hard for me. I was really shaken up after we got back from our Deacon training...

Walking over to the UP I received some unwelcome attention from an adoring onlooker...I do like feeling beautiful, but I do NOT like having people swear at me about it....or follow me down the street asking for my number. I'm not being melodramatic. This happened, and it was weird and unwelcome.

Then we went up into Garfield Heights, which is all fine and dandy, but we were going *door to door* (note looking of terror and turning green). So I went with John, I thought this would be the most comfortable for me, knowing he hates it too, and wouldn't make me talk to people...which he didn't, and I'm thankful for that. The first house we went to, no one was home...this was the one home John really wanted to stop at, because she lives right next to the vacant lot that we're trying to garden on. (Oh, right, we're doing all this to survey the neighborhood about how they feel about us gardening in the vacant lots behind their houses) The next house, a young kid answered the door, which was fine, but he looked terrified, and told us his parents were sleeping - who knows what that meant, but he looked so scared, and it broke my heart. Then we went to two houses, the first of which the man just wrote us off, and basically asked us to leave - very politely though. The second man tried to hide from us, by going back in his house while we walked up the stairs, John talked to him anyway. He told us we could do whatever we want, and went back inside. Still not so disheartening, mostly normal for door to door action. The next houses absolutely broke my heart.

The man was standing in a window, and when John asked him about the garden, he said "I don't even think about that" - which, listening between the lines, made me think about all the shit going on in their lives, and how of course they didn't worry about what the vacant properties would turn into. There is so much more to worry about. He had a great smile though, and laughed when John asked him if he would like us to bring him some fresh vegetables (he did think this was a good idea I think). The next place we stopped had a group of teenagers, who I, very honestly, was terrified of, but John was very patient (I could learn a lot, right?) (there are too many commas there) and they were really disrespectful, and clearly didn't want us there, and one of them hit on me, and ugh. Again. Broken heart. The next house we stopped at, a group of adults were sitting at (very high) and we talked to them pleasantly enough, but the man started asking about whether or not we had ID...that was just weird. I started to laugh, realized he was serious, and felt very foolish and out of place.

I wanted to cry. I don't understand how these things happen...how cities become this, how we are so broken, with no one to lift us up. I am this person too, I am not better than any of the people we met tonight, I am equally fucked up...We a just broken in different ways...and it hurts my heart.

I don't know how to be a deacon. It's the same reason I didn't want to be a social worker, because at the end of the day my heart is broken. My father commented to me that I have been given the responsibility to see the broken things because I can handle them, because I can pray, because it breaks my heart. And this just hurts more. I don't know how to hurt for the world, and still have hope. I guess we just cling to Jesus.

The amazing thing is that my legs don't hurt. In fact, my shoulder doesn't either (which hurt more than my legs yesterday). I did it thought, all 7 point something miles...and it wasn't that bad! I did ask John how to fix my bike though. 

Writing you say? I like this whole "just write when you feel like it, and don't worry about what comes out" thing...but it's just funny to think about writing... i don't think i'm a writer - but i secretly want to be. The reason I don't think I'm a writer, is because I don't think I could ever feel comfortable letting someone read anything I've written. i have journals upon journals of poetry, that I'm pretty sure NO ONE has ever seen... that would be too weird right?

Other 'w" words.... Waiting for "W" to leave! Only 270 days left...although I'm not sure how hopeful to feel about what's coming next. Wishing - timothy and I talked about this last night, and you'll know what I'm talking about when I say I'm wishing for chapter 11 and the continuation of the saga. and a happy ending!! 

Walruses. Just a funny 'w' word.

<font color="#800080">I realize no one wants to know, but i totally have cramps in my legs and butt. I walked today though! Mission accomplished. Walking to get hair cut tomorrow - it's gonna be fun!</font>

So. We (you know who you are) made a pact (? not really, I'm just being dramatic) to walk more places, because really, nothing we go to is very far away. Americans drive too much. Those jerks : / 

The more important point is I found a website "mapmyrun" (something like that in the title) which helped me to figure out how many miles it is depending on how I decide to walk to work. Mostly it's about 3.5, which took me about an hour last time, although I'm hoping to cut down on that tomorrow...although, if i walk first thing in the morning, Lord knows I'll be slower. 

But anyway, i feel good about this so called "pact", it feels good to be walking so much of my day! It makes me feel like I'm doing my part to save the planet. ha ha, right, it's all going to pot anyway. Not really, I know one person deciding to walk can make a difference, it just feels feeble that's all. Really i should bike. I LOVE biking, i just hate hills, and i live at the top of a big hill. plus drivers here are stupid, and i think they like hitting people on bikes. maybe they think it's a game. well...we'll see what happens. A lot will depend on how much sleep I have.

I was reading an article last night about E-mail invitations, and whether or not we have to respond to them the same way etiquette required of paper invitations. It was interesting, basically the consensus was that it didn't matter what form the announcement came in, but your relationship to that person. I think this is CRAP. The informality of an e-mail engagement announcement, or birth announcement, or whatever, SO informal...I don't feel the need to send gifts, or even respond to these announcements!!! Ack!!! 

Give me a handwritten, beautiful stationary announcement, any day.

I was reminded today, it's still freaking me out, that every time I have a migraine, bad things happen in my brain. Normal people go to hospitals (and one friend did today...yuck) and get tested for strokes when they have these symptoms. This just freaks me out. I know I need to get MRIs (but when one doesn' t have insurance, that doesn't happen), and hopefully I'll be able to stop thinking about it tonight. 

I'm takin' it easy tonight - prolly bed early, ooooh and a bubble bath.

Mmm...It's been a while hasn't it. 

I've been enjoying being outside, trying to start a garden. My poor little seedlings need more sun though - the pitfalls of a "mid-atlantic" state (you know, I heard that was an area of the states, except that I don't think it really means anything) with lots of clouds.

I - of course have been reading - I haven't kept track of how many, but I believe I'm somewhere in the 30s (so getting to 50 shouldn't be too bad :) )

This weekend is girls night! Wahoo!
